title: Understand the History and Evolution of Video Games
outcome: Students will be able to explain the historical development of video games, from early arcade games to contemporary digital gaming platforms.
indicators: Demonstrates knowledge of key milestones in video game history, identifies major technological advancements, and explains the shift from public arcades to home consoles and mobile gaming.

title: Analyze the Cultural and Social Impact of Video Games
outcome: Students will be able to critically assess how video games reflect and shape cultural values, norms, and societal issues.
indicators: Analyzes representations of gender, race, and identity in video games, and evaluates the role of video games in promoting or challenging societal stereotypes and beliefs.

title: Evaluate the Use of Video Games in Non-Entertainment Contexts
outcome: Students will explore the applications of video games beyond entertainment, including their use in medicine, education, and social engagement.
indicators: Demonstrates understanding of “serious games” and evaluates the effectiveness of games used in therapeutic, educational, or civic contexts.

title: Critically Assess the Ethical Dimensions of Gaming
outcome: Students will be able to discuss ethical concerns surrounding gaming, including issues related to violence, addiction, monetization practices, labor concerns, and virtual identities.
indicators: Identifies ethical issues in gaming, articulates various viewpoints on these issues, and demonstrates the ability to engage in thoughtful discussion on gaming ethics.

title: Understand and Evaluate the Role of Technology in Gaming
outcome: Students will gain insights into how technologies like artificial intelligence, virtual reality, and online connectivity shape gaming experiences.
indicators: Describes technological advancements in gaming, discusses the potential impacts of AI and VR on immersion, and explains the technical and social dimensions of multiplayer and competitive gaming.

title: Appreciate the Diversity of the Gaming Ecosystem
outcome: Students will understand the variety of gaming experiences, from indie games to eSports, and will recognize the contributions of diverse communities within the gaming industry.
indicators: Identifies key characteristics of indie games, explains the influence of modding and private servers on gaming communities, and describes the impact of community contributions on gaming culture.

title: Communicate Insights and Reflections on Gaming
outcome: Students will be able to express informed perspectives on gaming in written reflections and class discussions, connecting course content to broader social and cultural contexts.
indicators: Produces well-structured reflections on weekly topics, engages in thoughtful discussions, and demonstrates the ability to apply critical thinking skills to personal gaming experiences.

title: Identify Future Directions and Opportunities in the Gaming Industry
outcome: Students will be able to discuss potential future trends in gaming, reflecting on emerging technologies, cultural shifts, and player expectations.
indicators: Articulates a vision for the future of gaming, identifies potential areas for improvement in the industry, and connects current trends to historical and social insights.
